papers.summary: Opinion piece for special issue on the cognitive computational neuroscience of language
Two papers -- one on memory-augmented graph neural networks, and one on memory in humans vs. deep language models

conferences.summary: Organized in-person/hybrid Memory in Artificial and Real Intelligence (MemARI) workshop [website]
Collaborator Mariya Toneva (Princeton, Max Planck SWS) presented joint work on 'Language models that can remember'
